bug.author: surendra1472
bug.summary: Predicting using an imported model from another machine is giving error
bug.description:
Your Environment
Mindsdb version you tried to install: 1.9.2
Describe the bug I trained a model in aws machine and imported it in local machine. Then try to predict any values is giving bellow error. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior, for example:
Train a model in machine A and export the model from machine A Load the model in different machine lets say B Try to predict the target variable
Expected behavior It should predict the values without error.
Please find the attached screen shot. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27191684/71776038-554bc500-2fb0-11ea-9467-1858403b2ff8.PNG></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Fixed in a PR that should be done in 20 minutes, also went ahead and added support for importing multiple models at once while I was at it. Thank you for finding this out <denchmark-link:https://github.com/surendra1472>@surendra1472</denchmark-link> , I had actually forgotten we even had that function, I was just about to re-write it in order to more easily deploy models on other machines :P
